dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black screen: Echoing through a house, we hear A BOY BARK and A DOG YELPING. The picture comes up and a raggedy black dog tears down a of stairs, toward us. MAX, eight years old and wearing a white wolf suit, jumps down the stairs, tumbling toward the camera, growling and chasing the dog. For some reason, Max is holding a fork. He jumps to the bottom of the stairs tucking and rolling, screeching a feral war-cry and follows the dog off-screen Max chases the dog under the dining room table and closes He leaps and grabs the dog, and howling and somersaulting they wrestle happily together until the screen freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max's legs protrude from a hand-dug opening in a large sn embankment - a remnant of the morning’s snowplows. He crawls out and stands over it, surveying his creation. proud and crooked grin spreads across his face. He runs off toward his house, wanting badly to tell someo about it. INT./EXT. MAX’S HOME - DAY Max runs up to the window and taps on the glass. Inside i his sister Claire, 14, talking on the phone with great intensity. We see only Max’s eyes peering over the window sill.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (muffled through the glass) Hey Claire! Wanna see something great? Claire is too involved in her phone call to pay Max any attention.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Who else was there? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIWTA Revised November 21, 2008 (Buff) pg. 2

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (trying again) It’s an igloo.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I made it. Claire doesn’t respond. Her phone call is very important her.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: (responding to the intrusion) Yeah, my brother. No, I can’t. We’re supposed to go to my dad’s that weekend.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: The snowplows left some snow across the street... and I dug a hole into it.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Max, go play with your friends! Max is crushed. He walks off, dejected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max sits, resting in his igloo, deep in thought. He exits igloo with a makeshift flag -- a plastic bag tied to a bi twig. He marches over to a nearby wooden fence and barks orders to it.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: You! Go that way! You! Go that way! The fence isn’t responding. Max kicks it.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t talk to me like that. You’re just a fence. Go play with your own fence friends. Now move out! He runs to his fort and carefully secures his flag to the top. He adjusts it two or three times to make it just rig Max is something of a perfectionist. Just then, Max watches as a car pulls into his driveway. sees a group of teenage boys and girls get out of the car lope into his house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 WIWTA Revised November 21, 2008 (Buff) pg. 3 Max gets an idea. He jumps into his igloo and scoops up a of his snowballs. He can’t carry them all so he hurriedly rolls them out the entrance. He runs across the street to his house, closer to his pre carefully balancing his ammunition on his coat, kangaroo style. He hides behind the neighbor’s low fence. He waits, excitedly, organizing his arsenal while stealth peering over the fence. He watches the teens while they’r inside his house. Meanwhile, he makes more snowballs. The teenagers come outside with Claire. Max holds a snowb giddy with anticipation. He waits until they’re close eno and then jumps up and unleashes his projectiles. His aim isn’t so good, but he has the element of surprise on his side. A few snowballs hit the teenagers, and when they se that it’s him, they laugh and start throwing snowballs ba The fight is on. As Max is reloading, a large mound of snow is dumped on h back. The boys are close now, on the other side of the fe It’s time to retreat. Max bolts. He runs across the stree giddy -- the thrill of battle. He gets to his fort just in time and dives inside. He sli into his little cave - nervous and happy. He’s safe. But the boys are upon him. Through the fort’s entrance, h sees them approach. An arm comes through the side, searching for Max. Max squ out of the way, his eyes wide with alarm. Then there’s a sickening crunch from above. Another crunc They’re on the roof. Max looks up. The ceiling caves in. Max is trapped in a world of cold white. He claws his way out of the top, and we see his face, red wet with snow and tears. He’s cold and humiliated. The two boys see how upset Max is. They pull back, feelin awful. They walk back across the street. A horn honks - everyone is waiting. The boys run back to car. Max, hurt and shamed, looks for Claire among the teenager He finds her. Max and Claire lock eyes. Claire looks worr and feels bad for Max. Max hopes that Claire will come ov to help and comfort him - even to stick up for him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 11 12 15 WIWTA Revised November 21, 2008 (Buff) pg. 4

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: But she doesn’t. She turns away to talk to someone in the car. The car, with Claire in it, drives away. Shaken and raw, Max runs to the house. INT. MAX’S HOME - LATE AFTERNOON (CONTINUOUS) Max enters his house covered in snow, and runs upstairs i Claire’s room. Max rips off his hat and gloves and throws them on the fl He jumps up and down on Claire’s bed, dumping snow everywhere. On her dresser, he sees an elaborate valentin that he made her out of popsicle sticks and construction paper. It says “To Claire. Love, Max.” He grabs it and te it to pieces. As he calms down he realizes what he’s done. He picks up pieces of the valentine and walks to his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max lays in bed, silent, worried. On the dresser next to bed is a globe, an antique, lit from within. Max reads th inscription on a small brass panel on the globe: TO MAX, OWNER OF THIS WORLD. Love, Dad He hears high heels clicking in the kitchen below. Max lo forlorn, wishing he hadn’t done what he’s done. His mom’s footsteps echo through the house, getting closer to the stairs.

dialogues.text: (calling out) Hey! I’m home! We hear her walking upstairs. She enters the room and see Max under his covers. She sits down on his bed and kisses head. She’s wearing her work clothes - a wool skirt and w cotton blouse.

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: And she didn’t do anything about * it. *

dialogues.text: I’m sorry, honey. * (with a sly smile) * I would have done something about * it. * The guilt overtakes Max. * INT. CLAIRE’S BEDROOM -- CONTINUOUS * He brings his mom into Claire’s room. Water squishes * underfoot. *

dialogues.text: Max, what have you done? * She leaves the room and comes back with a stack of towels They both drop to their knees to soak up the mess. *

Overlooking the backyard, it’s a room used for man purposes. Outside, the snow has turned to rain and it’s coming down, silver streaks outside the window. Mom is typing on her computer, an older model, while talk on the phone to a co-worker. Max enters the room tentativ Feeling a bit guilty about earlier, Max wants to make up his mom. No, I’m just tired and there’s been some stuff here at home.... So what can I do to fix this? Max, trying to make her smile, adopts the posture of a ro She looks over to him. He continues walking robot-style a turns his head to smile at her, not noticing he’s about t walk into the wall. He falls down, to comic effect. His m buries a laugh and puts her finger to her lips, telling M to shush. Max grins. Success.

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into the phone) I know, I know. I, uh... but I better get started if I’m gonna turn it in in the morning. He plops himself on the floor under her desk and looks at mom’s feet. She’s taken off her shoes, but is still weari her tights; Max tugs gently on the tights over her right

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (CONT'D)

Aren’t those just your baby teeth? And he said, No, those are my grown-up teeth...and the vampires knew that he couldn't be a vampire anymore, so they left him. * Mom finishes typing and smiles proudly and sadly at Max.

dialogues.text: He reaches a small clearing around a fallen tree, where h has a few possessions stashed. Max grabs a large stick an stomps around, hitting things violently. The wind blows louder, whipping the leaves around in a fu Max, feeling the night's power, howls into the sky. He finds himself at the shore. The stars are out and the moon is reflected on the placid water. A boat floats. Max looks around to see if anyone is there The boat isn’t tied to anything, and starts to drift away Max rushes toward it and grabs the loose rope attached to He pulls the boat back slowly. He looks around again, wondering if the boat has an owner, if anyone’s watching. stands before the boat, the trees swaying violently aroun him. Max steps into the boat. The vessel slowly drifts away. Max allows the boat to drift, watching seriously and 40 intentionally as the land grows more distant. The boat cuts quickly through the sea. Max looks past the bow toward his destination. There is nothing but open water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pale early light paints the ocean pink. We see a wide, shot, with Max and his boat a tiny speck in the vast ocea On board, we see Max look around at the horizon line. In front of him, no signs of the city. Behind him is just wa and sky. No land in sight. He settles in for a long journey. 46 Max sails in and out of nights and days. He’s hungry and thirsty. Rain comes and goes. He’s cold and wet and exhau -- and it seems he’1ll never see land again. Finally, after many days, off the bow of the boat, he see landmass, and within it, a bright glow. Cut: Night. He’s closer now. The island is in sight. A gr black mound in the sea, with an orange glow - a fire - in middle. 38

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 57 58 59 WIWTA Revised November 21, 2008 (Buff) pg. 14

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landing on the beach is rough-going. The surf is thunderi and Max's boat is tossed about like a toy. When he’s close enough, he jumps from the boat, gasping f the water’s cold. He gets his bearings and pulls the boat ashore. He stands and assesses the island. Beyond the beach and the bluffs above, he sees a forest w a large fire raging. The flames ebbs and flow, bursting periodically like a growing bonfire. There are sounds of chaos in the distance, audible even f the beach. Max, wet and cold, knows his only chance at survival is to climb the cliffs and move toward the warmt the fire. Max skulks through the foliage like a cat. This is a trul dangerous, muddy forest - wild, primal and unpredictable. the sounds get louder, Max comes upon a clearing. Through the trees Max sees an enormous fire. Around it ar ten large huts, made of interlocking branches. Max stays A huge creature appears in silhouette, backlit by the fir Hiding in the grass, Max watches, enthralled. Max studies this creature as he walks around, crushing on these huts with his enormous arms. This beast is CAROL -- huge, striped and with two horns atop his head.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: That’s it. Tear 'em all down. Tear ‘em down. Come on! We’ve got a few more to go over here. (beat) Is anyone going to help me?

dialogues.text: 59 60 WIWTA Revised November 21, 2008 (Buff) pg. 18

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: But I know what I’m doing. From far away, Carol hears a sound. It sounds like a smal animal growling. Carol looks around to see what this noise is. It’s gettin louder. Everybody looks around to see what it is. Suddenly Max bursts into the scene, flying through the si of a hut. He startles everybody. Wildly, he swings a huge stick around, destroying everything in his path.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: Ira, what is it?

dialogues.speaker: IRA
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: Doesn't smell like anything. Carol watches Max, excited by what he sees, but also unsu about who or what this thing is. As Max is smashing stuff, he exchanges glances with Carol Max hurls himself into one of the huts and lands on the ground, in a comic thud. Carol approaches Max, looms over and sniffs him. Max is nervous, but sniffs Carol back. Th growl at each other. Carol laughs.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: (to the others) See, this guy gets it. (to Max) Hey... um... weird little... (unsure what to call him) -.. thing. I like the way you destroy stuff. Good technique. There’s a spark to your work that can’t be taught.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (as if it was nothing) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Alright, see that one over there? You take that one, I’1l1 take this one. See who can do it faster. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Okay. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 59 60 beri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 60 61 WIWTA Revised November 21, 2008 (Buff) pg. 19

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Go! Carol runs off, smashing a hut on the other side. With his big stick, Max approaches one of the last remain huts. He smashes it and creates a large hole. Inside the Max is surprised to see a large and menacing bull-like creature, THE BULL. Max is frightened, and backs off. Whe turns around, he bumps into Douglas, who looms over him.

dialogues.speaker: DOUGLAS
dialogues.text: Hey, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I’m just helping.

dialogues.speaker: DOUGLAS
dialogues.text: By smashing our houses?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: These are your houses?

dialogues.speaker: DOUGLAS
dialogues.text: (defensively) Yeah. What's wrong with them?

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: (feeling judged) What do your houses look like?

dialogues.speaker: IRA
dialogues.text: I bet his houses are funny looking.

dialogues.speaker: DOUGLAS
dialogues.text: Look, we worked very hard on these. Then you, sir, showed up and started “helping.” Max stammers.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: I’m cold.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: (to Max) Who are you? Are you one of K.W.’s new friends?

dialogues.speaker: DOUGLAS
dialogues.text: (disapproving) Oh, are you Bob or Terry? Max looks confused, unsure of how to answer all this. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e % |  61 WIWTA Revised November 21, 2008 (Buff)

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I don’t even know who that is.

dialogues.speaker: IRA
dialogues.text: He looks like a Bob.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: Things are getting crazy here. This thing’s dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: You're scaring me. They stare at Max. Max is growing more and more with the direction this is heading.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: You know what I say, if you've got a problem, eat it.

dialogues.speaker: DOUGLAS
dialogues.text: It’s the only way to solve these types of issues.

dialogues.speaker: IRA
dialogues.text: Yeah. The only way. pg. 20 61 concerned The creatures circle in on Max as they discuss eating him Max looks from one Wild Thing to the other, as Judith, Ir Alexander and the Bull grow closer. Carol is still on the other side of the clearing, smashing the last of the huts

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: Oh, he’s probably got those little bird bones.

dialogues.speaker: DOUGLAS
dialogues.text: I hate those.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: You have those little bird bones that are gonna cut up my mouth, don’t you?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (desperately) No, I don’t have bird bones.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: You better not. You better not be difficult to eat. Did you think of that? God, you’re selfish. I hope you don’t taste as selfish as you look. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 61 WIWTA Revised November 21, 2008 (Buff)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Alexander laughs.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Stop... pg. 21 They're breathing hard. Their teeth are gigantic. Ira lic his lips. The Bull snorts. Max looks up at them, panicked backed into a corner. He has to do something.

dialogues.speaker: IRA
dialogues.text: Come here.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Stop!

dialogues.speaker: IRA
dialogues.text: Oh, look at him - so delectable, so chewable. The Wild Things continue to close in on him. He arches hi back and lets out a voice much greater and more commandin than we could ever expect:

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: Why? Max is acting like he’s casting a spell on them. The Wild Things freeze in their tracks. All is silent. Ca far off, hears the commotion and heads over. There’s a split second when Max can’t believe it worked. there’s still tension. Max continues trying to stare the Wild Things down.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Because you can’t eat me. You didn’t know that, so I forgive you. But don’t try it again.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: Why not? Carol shows up now, intrigued by Max’s power.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I have powers from another land. From ancient times. Don’t make me show you. I had to show these Vikings once-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Revised November 21, 2008 (Buff) pg. 22 (3)

dialogues.speaker: IRA
dialogues.text: Viking? What's a Viking?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (building confidence) They wear horn hats, and they’re big -- bigger than you! One time they attacked me in my ice fortress. They tried to cave in the roof, but I’d made it too strong. I told them to be still but they didn’t. I conquered them. I had to make their heads explode. And then they realized I knew all the secrets to the world. And then you know what happened? They made me their king. Carol has been listening intently and nodding during Max' story.

dialogues.speaker: IRA
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: (seriously) You were a king? I knew there was something special about him. I told you guys. The other Wild Things are trying to take this all in, overwhelmed with all of this new information.

dialogues.speaker: IRA
dialogues.text: (worried for their safety) So wait, you exploded their heads?

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: (rolling her eyes) Oh come on. Our heads are bigger. (to Max, matter-of-factly) You can’t explode big heads.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: No, their heads were bigger than yours, believe me.

dialogues.speaker: IRA
dialogues.text: (incredulous) But you’re so small.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Small is good. My powers are able to slip right through the cracks. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Revised November 21, 2008 (Buff) (4)

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: What if the cracks are closed up?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Then I have a re-cracker that goes right through that.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: But what if we have some sort of material that re-crackers can’t get through?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Well, I have a double re-cracker that can get through any material in the whole universe and there’s no material outside of this universe that it can’t get through, and that’s the end and there’s nothing more powerful than that and that’s the end. Period.

dialogues.speaker: IRA
dialogues.text: Wow, he does sound powerful.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: (bothered that she’s been outsmarted, mumbling) Yeah, but there has to be some material somewhere, maybe really deep underground that if we combined it with --

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Shhh! Quiet. Carol turns to Max.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry. So you were their king and you made everything right?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: (forced nonchalance) Well uh, you know... what about loneliness?

dialogues.speaker: DOUGLAS
dialogues.text: What he’s saying is, will you keep out all the sadness? pg. 23 (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Revised November 21, 2008 (Buff) pg. (5)

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Yeah, I have a sadness shield. It keeps out all the sadness and it’s big enough for all of us.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I just do this to loneliness. (making a gesture of a bomb dropping on loneliness) Pooooww. The Wild Things are astounded.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: I knew it! When he showed up, I saw it. Why don’t you guys ever listen to me?

dialogues.speaker: DOUGLAS
dialogues.text: You're right, Carol, I didn’t see it. Max is gaining confidence.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: (confused) I don’t understand. He doesn’t look like a king. If he could be king, I could be king.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: Shhh, Alexander.

dialogues.speaker: IRA
dialogues.text: Um, were you the king where you came from?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Yeah. Yeah, for twenty years. The group murmurs, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: That’s really important.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: That’s impressive.

dialogues.speaker: IRA
dialogues.text: That is incredible. 24 (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e FF HH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIWTA Revised November 21, 2008 (Buff) pg. 25

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Well, looks like we found our king. (beat) You are our king, right? Max studies them, looking at all of their faces in need, waiting for his answer.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Yeah. (beat) I am.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm so relieved.

dialogues.speaker: IRA
dialogues.text: Sorry we were gonna eat you. We didn’t know you were king.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: That was insane. They all move in to hug him ceremoniously.

dialogues.speaker: IRA
dialogues.text: Oh my god! It’s K.W.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: What? We see a stringy-haired female Wild Thing, standing off t the side. She has a blase sort of attitude. Carol looks o surprised and nervous.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: (excited) Hi, K.W.!

dialogues.speaker: DOUGLAS
dialogues.text: (formally) K.W., it’s good to see you. Carol looks over, cautiously studying her. K.W. is checki out Max and tentatively making eye contact with Carol.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: (with a sneer) I thought you were with your new best friends, Bob and Terry. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIWTA Revised November 21, 2008 (Buff) pg. 26

dialogues.speaker: K.W.
dialogues.text: What are you guys doing? * (with a nod of her chin to * Max) * Who’s that? *

dialogues.speaker: IRA
dialogues.text: K.W. get in here. You gotta hear - this. We finally got a king. *

dialogues.speaker: DOUGLAS
dialogues.text: That’s true. *

dialogues.speaker: IRA
dialogues.text: A very impressive one. -

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER -
dialogues.text: Hey, K.W. we got a king! You and me - could go for a walk and I'll tell - you all about it. Anytime. You - could carry me like a little baby. -

dialogues.speaker: K.W. -
dialogues.text: Uh... yeah. Anyway, I don’t even - know if I’m sticking around. I just - came back to... - (beat, looking at Carol) - -..to get that one stick I left - here. Anyone see it? - Max studies her, trying to get a read on her. She checks out, too. -

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: I'll help. I’m good at finding * sticks. *

dialogues.speaker: IRA -
dialogues.text: K.W., he’s very powerful! *

dialogues.speaker: CAROL -
dialogues.text: (whispering to the other Wild Things) - Shh, shh. Stop. Don’t push her. - She'll figure it out for herself. * Just leave her be, okay? * (to Max) - King. This way your majesty, please. - 61A Carol leads Max over to a pile of smoking ashes. Max K.W., still trying to get a read on her. -  62 WIWTA Revised November 21, 2008 (Buff) pg. 27 Carol and the Bull guide Max to a smoldering fire. Judith Ira, Douglas and Alexander all linger behind and watch solemnly. The Bull passes by Max and roots around in some rubble on ground. Carol is standing a distance away, hands clasped behind his back - very much the guy who pulls the strings

dialogues.speaker: IRA
dialogues.text: (in a whisper of urgent excitement) Look! He’s going to make us happy, Judy. Judith lights up momentarily then catches herself.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: Yeah, but happiness isn’t always the best way to be happy.

dialogues.speaker: DOUGLAS
dialogues.text: Judith. Stop.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: He’s small for a king. Am I nuts? He’s small.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Yeah, that’s what I said.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: Alexander, shhh!

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: DOUGLAS
dialogues.text: I like it better when we have a king. (beat) I like Carol better when we have a king. K.W. Hey, what happened to our houses?

dialogues.speaker: DOUGLAS
dialogues.text: (lying to cover for Carol) Oh... um, they fell down. K.W. rolls her eyes and walks off. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIWTA Revised November 21, 2008 (Buff) pg. 28

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Bull takes a scepter from the ashes and hands it to M Max inspects the scepter reverently, and when he holds it instantly looks king-like. Carol smiles at him. Max watch as the Bull roots around for the crown. Amid the ashes, M sees a pile of bones. The Bull finds the crown near a rib femur, and gives it to Carol.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (quietly, pointing to the pile of bones) Are those... other kings?

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: (nervously) No, they were here when we got here. I never saw them. Never even noticed them. Max looks uncertain. He looks at Carol, and then the othe wild things. Ira gives him a big smile. Max smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JUMP AHEAD TO
dialogues.text: Carol crowns Max.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: You are now the king. (affecting a ceremonial sort of gravitas) And you will be a truly great king. Max grins with pride, looking up, trying to see the crown his head.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh it looks good on him, look. He looks great. Huh king?

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: King! King! King! King!

dialogues.speaker: DOUGLAS
dialogues.text: It looks perfect, Carol.

dialogues.speaker: IRA
dialogues.text: We have a king. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIWTA Revised November 21, 2008 (Buff) pg. 29

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: We got a king. Everything’s going * to be different now. * The Bull reaches down to pick up Max, to show him off to others. *

dialogues.speaker: IRA -
dialogues.text: Oh, I know this part! This is where - we're supposed to lift him up, and - it’s really exciting, right? -

dialogues.speaker: WILD THINGS
dialogues.text: Arroooo! Arrooooo! 63 As Max is lifted onto a destroyed hut, the Bull bonks head into a branch. * They all gather around Max, looking up at him. They all chant. *

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Hey King! What’s your first order of business? Max thinks for a moment, then arrives at the answer. *

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Let the wild rumpus start!

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Perfect answer! They all cheer. It was the right thing to say. They * celebrate. Judith shoves Ira.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: Yeah! You hear that? Start * rumpusing, lazy. *

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Come on. Come on, King! Max jumps off the hut and starts growling at the Wild Thi They make a circle around him and growl back, imitating h He acts like a monkey, and they act like monkeys. Max mak crazy rolling RRRR sound at Carol. Carol gleefully does i back. Max is in the center of it all, loving it. K.W. wat from afar, gauging the effect that Max has had on everyon Max takes off through the forest, and everyone follows hi (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIWTA Revised November 21, 2008 (Buff) pg. 30

dialogues.speaker: MAX -
dialogues.text: (as he runs) Guys! Follow me! * They run through the forest. Douglas trips over a fallen tree. Judith leaps over the tree, kicking Douglas in the head. They all keep going. * Max falls, gets up. The running and howling continues. -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max runs up a small incline to a clearing on top of a cli He circles a tree, dragging his claws on it. The Wild Thi do the same, but their claws shred the bark off of it. = They all run up to the cliff, howling with Max. Because M is standing close to the edge and they’re careless, they almost knock him off the cliff with someone’s hip. Carol immediately catches Max and places him back on the ground It’s comic, but also reminds us that there’s danger still this island. - 64A Together Max and the Wild Things stand at the edge of cliff, howling into the air over the vast ocean below. *

dialogues.speaker: WILD THINGS
dialogues.text: (howling) Aoooh! *

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Aahooooo! 64B It’s a glorious moment. Max looks all around him, at happy faces of the giant beasts. They’re all howling with abandon. Now Max notices that K.W. has joined them. She l amused. *

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (curious) * What? *

dialogues.speaker: K.W.
dialogues.text: You're funny looking. That’s all. * Carol notices Max and K.W. interacting and tries to get M attention back. -

dialogues.speaker: CAROL -
dialogues.text: Hey king, watch this. Max's attention is diverted by Carol. He’s left the cliff is now returning into the forest, jumping high in the air like a frog but with a thunderous thump each time he land

dialogues.speaker: 65A
dialogues.text: WIWTA Revised November 21, 2008 (Buff) pg. 31 Max sees Carol’s jumping skill and has an idea. He chases after him into the forest, trying to get his attention.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Hey Jumping Guy! Jumping Guy! Hey mister, wait up! Max continues to run after him.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey Jumping Guy! Hey!

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Hey King, watch this! Carol jumps up and hits his head on the tree branch, and falls down.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (laughing, shaking a fist to the tree) Alright tree, we’ll settle this later. Carol and Max laugh.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Carol and Max walk through the forest as the Wild Things continue to rumpus on their own.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Oh look. Everyone wants to be friends with the new guy.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: I hope you can tell how excited they are to have a king. Sometimes they have an odd way of showing it. I mean, not me, but sometimes they act weird, you know and it hurts other people’s feelings.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: Ira, my love.

dialogues.speaker: IRA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: Come here! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Revised November 21, 2008 (Buff) pg. 32 Carol and Max watch as Judith beckons Ira over to her.

dialogues.speaker: IRA
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Oh, that’s Judith and Ira. They’re in love. We see Judith hit Ira with the tree trunk. We see Alexander running through the forest.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Watch me! Look!

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: That’s Alexander.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Look, look! I hate this tree! Alexander runs head first into a tree. He falls down.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: He just wants attention. Don’t give him the satisfaction. Douglas appears, busting open some trees with his fists.

dialogues.speaker: DOUGLAS
dialogues.text: 77... 78... no, wait. No, no, that was... yeah that’s it, 78.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Oh, and that’s Douglas. I count on him for everything.

dialogues.speaker: DOUGLAS
dialogues.text: (modestly) Well, that’s not true.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: If I was stranded on a deserted island and could only take one thing, it would be Douglas. We could share him if you want, King.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: That sounds good, I might need one of those. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIWTA Revised November 21, 2008 (Buff)

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: (walking toward Douglas) Douglas, no no no, that’s not the way I want you to do it. Stop. I'll show you, wait.

dialogues.speaker: DOUGLAS
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry. Max turns to find Ira and Judith close.

dialogues.speaker: IRA
dialogues.text: He’s so little... (extending his huge hand to Max) We haven’t formally met. I’m Ira. I put the holes in the trees; maybe you saw those?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Abh..

dialogues.speaker: IRA
dialogues.text: Or maybe not. Anyways, it’s what I do. I mean, it’s not important like the things you do. Judith approaches and coughs.

dialogues.speaker: IRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, and this is Judith.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: Ah, you don’t really need to know me. I’m kind of a downer. Max laughs.

dialogues.speaker: IRA
dialogues.text: King, that’s not true.

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: (to Max) Hey, let me see your face. Alexander approaches, trying to see what’s going on.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: (forced nonchalance) You could introduce me to the king if you want. They all ignore Alexander. Pg. 33 (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIWTA Revised November 21, 2008 (Buff) pg. 34

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH
dialogues.text: (laughing, to Max) - Let me see your face. Oooh. What is * that? Don’t worry, let me see it. * She grabs his face, as if she’s a doctor and has seen som terrible lesion. Once she’s got him, she licks Max from c to forehead, and then laughs hysterically. * Max smiles tolerantly and wipes the saliva from his face. A loud crack behind them. The sound of a tree beginning t fall - it’s one that Douglas has punched. Max and Ira sca as it comes down with a great crash. -

dialogues.speaker: IRA
dialogues.text: You almost got me, Douglas! Almost got me. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Douglas is holding a cat in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: DOUGLAS
dialogues.text: (to cat) We almost got Ira. That would have been really funny. We’ll get him next time, won’t we? Yes, we will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 66 Carol is behind a rock watching K.W., who’s standing o the side, by herself. - Max runs up and dives behind the rock to see what Carol i looking at. -

dialogues.speaker: MAX -
dialogues.text: What are you doing? - Carol doesn’t say anything. He’s preoccupied, watching K. across the way. -

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is she the one you were mad at when - you were smashing stuff? -

dialogues.speaker: CAROL -
dialogues.text: Yeah... No! No, well, um... I * thought she was never coming back. *

dialogues.speaker: MAX -
dialogues.text: Well, it looks like she’s back now. =

dialogues.speaker: CAROL -
dialogues.text: Yeah, I hope so. - (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Revised November 21, 2008 (Buff) pg. 35 K.W., with a melancholy air about her, is standing apart the others and their fun. Max watches her as she takes everything in, processing it bit dismissive.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I’m gonna get her! Max starts to run toward K.W., getting ready to leap onto back. Carol panics.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: No! No Max, don’t! Don’t do that. She’s doesn’t like that kind o thing. Come back! Come back here!

dialogues.speaker: DOUGLAS
dialogues.text: £ (turning to see Max running toward K.W., urgently) Uh, King, I wouldn’t recommend that. Max runs down the log and leaps onto K.W.’s back with a h growl. Surprised, she stumbles back and falls to the grou laughing. Max rolls off, his crown tumbling off. K.W. laughs. Max jumps back up and leaps on her. He begins to tickle her. He sticks his finger in her nose. K.W. (laughing) Stop, stop. Stop it, stop it! pick someone else’s nose! Go Carol's expression is one of relief and happiness. He’s excited that she’s having fun. Carol runs to join in. K.W. rolls over, protecting Max as Carol lands on them.

dialogues.speaker: K.W., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look out!

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Ahh. Gotcha! One by one all the Wild Things jump on.

dialogues.speaker: IRA
dialogues.text: Whoa!

dialogues.text: The room is large, a studio of some kind. It’s messy but full of projects. Max enters and slowly walks around, tak everything in. On the main worktable, an entire city is laid out, almost 20 feet long and six feet tall - buildings shaped like mountains and hills in an organized, almost grid-like for Carol scurries about preparing his creation, anxious abou what Max will think. The details are immaculate and painstaking. It looks like would have taken 10 years to make. It’s a model world - controllable, predictable, tidy.
